Class SuffixArray

java.lang.Object
SuffixArray
public class SuffixArray extends Object
This class manages an array of integers (suffix array) and the text on which the suffix array has been built.
Version:
1.0 (8/1/2022)
Author:
Orazio Costanzo

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    protected static enum 
    SuffixArray.Sentinel
    This enum is used to construct suffix arrays with one or more strings passed as parameters.
    static class 
    SuffixArray.SuffixArrayBuilder
    This class constructs and return a suffix array.

    • printSA

      public void printSA(long n)
      Prints the first n suffixes.
      Parameters:
      n - number of elements you want to print.

    • printSA

      public void printSA(long m, long n)
      Skip the first m suffixes and print the next n suffixes.
      Parameters:
      m - number of suffixes you want to skip.
      n - number of elements you want to print.

    • buildSuffixArray

      public static SuffixArray buildSuffixArray(String text)
      Call Suffix.buildSuffixArray(text) to build a suffix array. Suffix.buildSuffixArray(text) ==> build(initialize(text). This method creates an integer array that contains the indexes of the sorted suffixes. Sorting algorithm from Arrays class.
      Parameters:
      text - The text on which to create the suffix array.
      Returns:
      return a SuffixArray object.
      See Also:
      • Arrays

    • buildSuffixArray

      public static SuffixArray buildSuffixArray(String... strings)
      Call Suffix.buildSuffixArray(text) to build a suffix array. Suffix.buildSuffixArray(text) ==> build(initialize(text). This method creates an integer array that contains the indexes of the sorted suffixes. Sorting algorithm from Arrays class.
      Parameters:
      strings - Create suffix array from more strings.
      Returns:
      return a SuffixArray object.
      See Also:
      • Arrays

    • textCleaner

      public static String textCleaner(String text)
      Clean the text with specific filter, before processing it.
      Parameters:
      text - Raw text (without being processed)
      Returns:
      Returns the filtered text

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String object representing this Suffix Array.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Returns the suffix array in the format: index:[i-th] Suffix:substring(index)

    • isSubstring

      public long isSubstring(String string)
      Check if there is a substring in the suffix array (binarysearch).
      Parameters:
      string - String to search for.
      Returns:
      if it exists, it returns a positive long, otherwise -1.

    • getStrings

      public List<String> getStrings()

    • getAlphabet

      public static Character[] getAlphabet(SuffixArray sa)
      Builds an Character[] by taking the (distinct) characters in the text.
      Parameters:
      sa - Suffix Array.
      Returns:
      Character[] array with al distinct characters in the text.

    • getStrFre

      public int[] getStrFre(String str)
      Search a str in the suffix array, if exists return number of repetitions else return new int[]{0,0,0}
      Parameters:
      str - Substring of which we want to count the repetitions.
      Returns:
      int[]{n,start,end} : n = number of repetitions, range(start= first_substring_index, end= last_substring_index).

    • getMax_lcp

      public int getMax_lcp()
      Returns the maximum element of the lcp array.
      Returns:
      An integer indicating the maximum.

      public int getSaElement(int index)
      Returns the element of the suffix array in the index passed as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      index - index passed as a parameter.
      Returns:

    • setFilter

      public static void setFilter(String regex)
      Change the filter to be applied to the text before it is processed. Default filter is: \\s+|\\W. If there is an PatternSyntaxException , catch it and not change the filter.
      Parameters:
      regex - Regex that sets the new filter.

    • setReplace

      public static void setReplace(String new_replace)
      This method replaces the filtered characters (via the regex) with a string. The default replacement string is "",(empty string),otherwise enter the new string to replace.
      Parameters:
      new_replace - New string to replace.
